Class LogoutController

java.lang.Object
scot.gov.scotaccountclient.LogoutController
@Controller @RequestMapping("/logout") public class LogoutController extends Object
Controller handling all logout operations for the ScotAccount client application.

This controller manages three distinct logout flows:

1. User-Initiated Front-Channel Logout

Endpoints: GET/POST /logout

  • Triggered when user clicks "logout" button
  • Clears local session and cookies
  • Redirects to ScotAccount's end_session_endpoint for complete logout
  • ScotAccount redirects back to /logout/logged-out when done

2. OIDC Back-Channel Logout

Endpoint: POST /logout/backchannel

  • Called directly by ScotAccount Identity Provider
  • Receives signed JWT logout_token
  • Validates token signature and claims per OIDC spec
  • Invalidates local session
  • Returns HTTP 200 OK (no redirect)

3. Post-Logout Callback

Endpoint: GET /logout/logged-out

  • Called by ScotAccount after front-channel logout completes
  • Simply redirects user back to home page
See Also:
  • OIDC RP-Initiated Logout
  • OIDC Back-Channel Logout

  • Method Details

    • initiateLogoutPost

      @PostMapping public String initiateLogoutPost(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Handles user-initiated logout via POST request.

      This endpoint is typically called when the user clicks a logout button/link. Both GET and POST methods are supported for maximum compatibility.

      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request
      response - HTTP response for setting cookies
      Returns:
      Redirect to ScotAccount's logout endpoint or home page

    • initiateLogoutGet

      @GetMapping public String initiateLogoutGet(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Handles user-initiated logout via GET request.

      This endpoint is typically called when the user clicks a logout button/link. Both GET and POST methods are supported for maximum compatibility.

      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request
      response - HTTP response for setting cookies
      Returns:
      Redirect to ScotAccount's logout endpoint or home page

    • handlePostLogoutCallback

      @GetMapping("/logged-out") public String handlePostLogoutCallback(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Callback endpoint after ScotAccount completes the logout process.

      ScotAccount redirects the user here after successfully logging them out at the Identity Provider level. This is the final step in the front-channel logout flow.

      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request (may contain state parameter for validation)
      Returns:
      Redirect to application home page

    • handleBackchannelLogout

      @PostMapping({"/backchannel","/back-channel"}) @ResponseBody public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> handleBackchannelLogout(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Handles OIDC Back-Channel Logout requests from ScotAccount Identity Provider.

      OIDC Back-Channel Logout Specification Compliance:

      • Accepts POST with application/x-www-form-urlencoded body
      • Receives signed JWT in logout_token parameter
      • Validates JWT signature using JWKS endpoint
      • Validates all required JWT claims per spec
      • Returns HTTP 200 OK on success (no redirect)
      • Returns HTTP 400 Bad Request on validation failure
      • Sets Cache-Control: no-store header

      Flow:

      1. ScotAccount sends POST with logout_token
      2. Validate token parameter is present
      3. Validate JWT signature and claims
      4. Invalidate user's session
      5. Return 200 OK
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request containing logout_token parameter
      response - HTTP response for setting headers
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with HTTP 200 OK or 400 Bad Request
      See Also:
      • OIDC Back-Channel Logout Spec

    • performFrontChannelLogout

      private String performFrontChannelLogout(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Performs the front-channel logout flow initiated by the user.

      Steps:

      1. Extract ID token from authenticated user session
      2. Clear Spring Security context
      3. Invalidate HTTP session
      4. Clear application cookies
      5. Redirect to ScotAccount's end_session_endpoint with ID token hint
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request
      response - HTTP response for cookie manipulation
      Returns:
      Redirect to ScotAccount logout or home page

      private String extractIdTokenFromAuthentication()
      Extracts the ID token from the current authentication context.
      Returns:
      ID token string, or null if not available

      Invalidates the HTTP session if one exists.
      Parameters:

    • clearCookies

      private void clearCookies(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Clears application cookies by setting them to expire immediately.
      Parameters:
      response - HTTP response for adding cookie headers

    • buildScotAccountLogoutUrl

      private String buildScotAccountLogoutUrl(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, String idToken)
      Builds the complete logout URL for ScotAccount's end_session_endpoint.

      Constructs URL with required parameters:

      • id_token_hint - for identifying the user's session
      • post_logout_redirect_uri - where to redirect after logout
      • state - security parameter to prevent CSRF
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request for constructing callback URL
      idToken - ID token to include as hint
      Returns:
      Complete logout URL for redirect

    • generateSecureState

      private String generateSecureState()
      Generates a cryptographically secure random state parameter.
      Returns:
      Base64-encoded random state string

    • validateLogoutToken

      private void validateLogoutToken(String logoutToken) throws Exception
      Validates a logout token JWT according to OIDC Back-Channel Logout specification.

      Validation performed:

      1. JWT signature verification using JWKS
      2. Issuer (iss) matches expected ScotAccount issuer
      3. Audience (aud) contains this client's ID
      4. Issued At (iat) claim is present
      5. Events claim contains backchannel-logout event URI
      6. Either subject (sub) or session ID (sid) is present
      7. Nonce claim is NOT present (per spec requirement)
      Parameters:
      logoutToken - The logout token JWT string to validate
      Throws:
      Exception - if any validation check fails

    • validateIssuer

      private void validateIssuer(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the issuer (iss) claim matches expected value.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • validateAudience

      private void validateAudience(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the audience (aud) claim contains this client's ID. Audience can be either a single string or an array of strings.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • validateIssuedAt

      private void validateIssuedAt(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the issued at (iat) claim is present.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • validateEvents

      private void validateEvents(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates the events claim contains the backchannel logout event URI.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • validateSubjectOrSessionId

      private void validateSubjectOrSessionId(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates that either subject (sub) or session ID (sid) claim is present. Per OIDC spec, at least one must be present to identify the logout target.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException

    • validateNonceAbsent

      private void validateNonceAbsent(io.jsonwebtoken.Claims claims) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Validates that nonce claim is NOT present. Per OIDC Back-Channel Logout spec, logout tokens must not contain nonce.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException
